fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported their vehicle was stolen from the West Dublin Station. 1707-0961 L22

fields.title: Violation of Court Order (Arrest)
fields.body: A male was arrested for violation of a court order at the Powell Street Station and booked at the local jail. 1707-0952 L22

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officers contacted an adult female for fare evasion and discovered that she had a $10,000 warrant for theft. The female was booked into the San Francisco County Jail for the warrant. 1707-0988 L16

fields.title: Criminal Threats/Warrant Arrest (Prohibition Order Issued)
fields.body: A female station agent reported a male suspect threatening to batter her at the station. The male chased the agent into the employee restroom, where she could secure herself while waiting for officers to arrive. When officers arrived, they contacted the station agent and the belligerent male suspect. He was positively identified and taken into custody. He was also found to have two $10,000 warrants for battery and violation of a court order. The male was issued a prohibition order before being booked into the Santa Rita Jail for making criminal threats and the warrants. The agent was not physically injured. 1707-0992 L16

fields.title: Robbery
fields.body: A male victim was walking through the parking structure when two male suspects (BMs, 14-16 years, dark hoodies) approached him. One of the males punched him in the head while the other displayed a small, black semi-automatic handgun. They then took his backpack, which contained a laptop, cellphone and headphones. The victim claimed no injuries and declined medical attention. The suspects were not located. 1707-0986 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A vehicle was burglarized while parked in the lot between 1700-2100 hours. Entry was made via window smash, but nothing was taken. 1707-1051 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A vehicle was burglarized while parked in the lot between 0645-2245 hours. The method of entry is unknown (no damage). Coins/change and a cup holder were taken. 1707-1054 L16

fields.title: Grand Theft (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: A catalytic converter was taken from a 2003 Acura while it was parked in the lot between 1800-1830. 1707-1047 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A vehicle was burglarized while parked in the lot. The method of entry is unknown (no damage). Cash, car parts and a Fastrak transponder were taken. 1707-1050 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A vehicle was burglarized (window smash) while parked at the station. Coins/change and a Fastrak transponder were taken. The crime occurred between 1730-2108 hours. 1707-1046 L16

fields.title: Theft from Person
fields.body: A victim reported they were pickpocketed for their cell phone at the Embarcadero Station. 1707-1012 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A Honda was burglarized while parked at the South Hayward Station. Loss was a Fast Track. 1707-1036 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A Nissan was burglarized while parked at the Bay Fair Station and sustained a window smash. Loss was a car stereo faceplate, tools, jewelry and vape pen. 1707-1030 L22

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their Toyota from the Bay Fair Station. 1707-1037 L22

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their Nissan from the South Hayward Station. 1707-1031 L22

fields.title: Violation of Court Order
fields.body: A suspect who was reported to be bothering people at the station was determined to be in violation of a court order prohibiting the suspect from being at a BART station. The suspect was arrested and booked for the violation. 1707-1144 L11

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A white Chevrolet pickup truck was stolen from the 6th level of the parking structure between 7/20/17 at 14:30 and 7/21/17 at 07:15. 1707-1130 L11

fields.location: Fremont Train at 19th Street Station Oakland
fields.title: Brandishing Weapon / Vandalism
fields.body: A BART passenger reported a man on a train who was vandalizing seat cushions by cutting them with a knife and who was also brandishing the knife in a threatening manner. The suspect fled from the train at 19th Street station and was not located by officers who searched the area. There were no injuries and minor damage to a seat on a single train car. 1707-1134 L11

fields.title: Suspicious Person/Narcotics Arrest
fields.body: An officer detained a male for possible possession of stolen property (possession of 3 bicycles) at the Walnut Creek Station. A records check showed the male was on probation with a full search clause. A search revealed the male was in possession of narcotics and was placed under arrest. The bicycles were recovered and held for safe keeping, pending an on-going investigation. The male was booked into the Martinez Detention Facility on possession of narcotics and a probation violation. 1707-1129 L22

fields.title: Bike Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that their unknown make/model blue mountain bike was stolen from the racks in the paid area, between 0630-1400 hours.  The victim secured the bike with a cable lock.  1707-1166 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported her 1995 Nissan Altima was stolen from the South Hayward Station, between 0630-1800 hours. 1707-1162 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported their silver 2000 Acura Integra was burglarized while parked at the Bay Fair Station. The vehicle was found unlocked and the interior was searched. Loss was an auto battery and a sub-woofer speaker. 1707-1159 L22

fields.title: Grand Theft
fields.body: A victim reported their catalytic converter was stolen from their Honda while parked at the Lafayette Station on 7/19/17. 1707-1079 L22

fields.title: Battery/Assault with Deadly Weapon
fields.body: BART Police received several 911 emergency calls reporting a male was assaulted and kicked in the head by a group of 5-6 juveniles. Officers responded "Code 3", arrived at the Richmond Station and located the victim who was transported to a local hospital for his injuries. Officers searched the area for the juveniles but were unable to locate them. During the investigation, the crime was determined to have occurred in Richmond Police Department's jurisdiction and they were notified. BART Police completed a supplemental report and all information was forwarded to Richmond Police. Station video was requested. 1707-1078 L22

fields.title: Carrying a Concealed Dirk or Dagger/Violation of Probation/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officers responded to the West Oakland BART station on the report of a male subject who was in possession of two sharp objects aboard a train.  Officers contacted a male subject who was found to be in possession of a concealed knife.  A records check revealed an outstanding misdemeanor arrest warrant.  The subject was taken into custody and booked into Glenn Dyer jail.  1707-1071  L15

fields.title: Violation of a Court Order
fields.body: The on-duty station agent called to report a male subject had attempted to batter him by swinging at him.  Officers contacted the subject and a records check revealed the subject to be on probation out of Alameda County with a condition to stay away from BART.  The subject was taken into custody and booked into Santa Rita jail.  The station agent declined to press charges for the assault.  1707-1067  L15

fields.title: Vehicle Theft
fields.body: An employee reported the theft of their vehicle while it was parked at the Concord Yard.    Occurred from 2359 hours on 7/19/2017 until 0240 hours on 7/20/2017.  1707-1070  L15

fields.title: Grand Theft from a Vehicle (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: Victim reported the theft of their catalytic converter while their vehicle was parked in the permit lot at the station.  Occurred on 7/19/2017 between the hours of 1600 - 1900.  1707-1064

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Service/Possession of Narcotics/Probation Violation
fields.body: An male subject was contacted for fare evasion.  A records check revealed two outstanding misdemeanor arrest warrants.  The subject was taken into custody and a search incident to arrest yielded heroin.  The subject cited for fare evasion and booked into the Martinez Detention Facility for the other charges.  1707-1061  L15

fields.title: Robbery
fields.body: A male victim was robbed of his duffel bag after two suspects (BMs, 20s, no further description) pushed him down in the parking lot. The suspects fled in a black Jeep Cherokee and were not located. The victim refused medical attention. 1707-1123 L16

fields.title: Robbery
fields.body: A male victim was robbed of $500 by a female suspect (WF, 40s, 5'4", white shirt with the word "pink" on it) who brandished a knife and punched him. The suspect fled and was not located and the victim refused medical attention. 1707-1119 L16

fields.title: Grand Theft (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their catalytic converter from their 2002 Aura TL while parked at the Coliseum Station. 1707-1107 L22

fields.title: Theft From Person
fields.body: A victim reported two juveniles attempted to take her headphones and wallet at the Hayward Station. The juveniles were only able to take her headphones and fled from the station. 1707-1105 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported their 2007 Volkswagen was burglarized while parked at the Colma Station, between 0725-1610 hours. Entry was made via rear window smash and the loss was a brown "Coach" bag. 1707-1094

fields.title: Auto Burglary (4)
fields.body: An officer reported four auto burglaries at the South San Francisco Station, between 0655-1940 hours. Entries were made via window smashes. 1707-1095 L22

fields.title: Suspicious Circumstance
fields.body: A witness reported that a male suspect battered a second adult male aboard a Daly City bound train.  The victim, who sustained a minor facial injury, advised responding officers he was not battered.  Officers were unable the potential suspect (black male wearing white headphones, white tennis shoes and a gray hoodie), whose description was provided by the witness.  The victim was transported to the hospital as he was also intoxicated. 1707-1198 L10

fields.title: Grand Theft (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: The victim reported the theft of their 2004 Honda Element’s catalytic converter while the vehicle was parked at the station on 7/21/17.  1707-1191 L10

fields.title: Willfully Delay-Obstruct Police/Arrest
fields.body: A male suspect detained by an officer for fare evasion repeatedly refused to identify himself to police.  The suspect was then arrested for delaying police and booked into the county jail without incident.  1707-1183 L10

fields.title: Auto Burglaries
fields.body: Two separate victims reported that their vehicles were burglarized while parked at the station.  1707-1238/1240 L10

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: The victim reported the theft of their Acura Integra while it was parked at the station.  1707-1227 L10

fields.title: Auto Burglaries
fields.body: A total of three vehicles were burglarized while parked in the station’s main (rear) parking lot.  1707-1234 L10

fields.title: Attempted Robbery
fields.body: Two suspects attempted to rob a female victim of her cell phone in the east parking lot.  The suspects brandished a BB gun and attempted to take the phone.  The victim was knocked down, but retained possession of her phone.  The suspects fled into the surrounding area and were not located.  1707-1347 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that his white 2005 Ford F250 was stolen from the Pleasanton lot.  1707-1338 L18

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A patron reported that his gray 2002 Toyota Tacoma pickup was burglarized while parked on the second level of the structure, between 0730-1915 hours.  An unknown suspect gained entry by forcing the rear sliding window, and stole $6 in spare change.  1707-1337 L18

fields.title: Narcotics Activity/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officers detained a male for loitering in a drug area.  Record checks showed that he had two outstanding arrest warrant, totaling $27,500, for possession of narcotics paraphernalia, held by the Marin County Sheriff's Office.  The man was arrested and booked at the SF County Jail.  1707-1332 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that his 1999 Honda Civic was stolen from the lot on the Pleasanton side.  1707-1333 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that his gold 1998 Infiniti i30 was stolen on 7/23/17, between 1730-2100 hours.  1707-1321 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that his 2004 Yamaha YZ50 scooter was stolen between 6/3/17 at 0700 hours to 7/10/17 at 1800 hours.  1707-1326 L18

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A patron reported that their blue 2014 Mazda van was burglarized while parked on the first level of the parking structure, between 1700-2359 hours.  An unknown suspect smashed the right rear window to gain entry and stole clothing and other miscellaneous items.  1707-1264 L18

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Service
fields.body: Officers detained a female suspect for fare evasion.  Record checks showed that she had three outstanding arrest warrants, totaling $19,500, for theft and possession of stolen property, held by San Francisco, San Mateo and Alameda Counties.  The suspect was arrested and booked at the SF County Jail.  1707-1259 L18

fields.title: Resist/Obstruct Police Arrest
fields.body: A male suspect was taken into custody after refusing to submit himself to a lawful detention.  He was then booked into the county jail for resisting arrest and possessing narcotics' paraphernalia.  1707-1241 L10

fields.title: Outside Assist-Castro Valley Station
fields.body: BART officers were dispatched to the Castro Valley Station to locate a theft suspect on a train. The theft, which was reported by the ACSO, occurred in Dublin. The officers detained a male suspect. a records check revealed an active felony warrant. The case was turned over to ACSO as it occurred in their jurisdiction. 1707-1369 L24

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported that they parked and locked their vehicle (1985 Honda Civic) in the parking lot on 7/24/17, at about 0830 hours.  They returned on 7/24/17 at about 2030 hours to find their had been burglarized. 1707-1360 L24

fields.title: Grand Theft from Person
fields.body: Victim reported a black male adult grabbed his cellular telephone from his hands while aboard a Dublin/Pleasanton bound train as it was approaching the West Oakland Station.  The black male was described as being approximately 25-30 years of age, heavy set, wearing a black tank top and dark colored pants or shorts.  The black male adult fled the train upon the arrival at the station with two black females.  1707-1412  L15

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: Telephone report taken from victim who reported their vehicle burglarized while it was parked at the San Leandro Station.  The vehicle was locked when it was parked and found unsecured upon the victim's return.  The vehicle was entered by unknown means and loss was the car stereo.  1707-1410  L15

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported their 2013 Jeep was burglarized while parked at the Lafayette Station, between 0700-1830 hours. A passenger window was smashed and the loss was a backpack. 1707-1403 L22

fields.title: Bike Theft
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their Felt bike from the MacArthur Station, between 0900-1845 hours. The bike was secured with a Kryptonite U-Lock and cable. 1707-1405 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: Two vehicles were burglarized (1999 BMW & 2012 Dodge Avenger) while parked at the Fruitvale Station, between 0845-1800 hours. The passenger windows were smashed and the loss was car stereos. 1707-1388 L22

fields.title: Bicycle Theft
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their men's Schwinn bike from the Lake Merritt Station, between 0700-1700 hours. The bike was secured with a Kryptonite U-Lock. 1707-1386 L22

fields.title: Bicycle Theft
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their Men's TREK bike from the North Berkeley Station on 7/20 (0700 hours) and 7/21 (0800 hours). The bike was secured with a U-Lock. 1707-1397 L22

fields.title: Warrant Arrest/Resisting Arrest/False ID to Peace Officer-Lake Merritt Station
fields.body: Officers responded to the Lake Merritt Station to investigate a report of a male causing a disturbance aboard a train. Upon arrival officers located a subject (Alamillo, Donato 43 y/o, San Francisco) matching the provided description on the train. The subject attempted to flee on foot. The officers detained the subject, who initially provided a false name.  A records check revealed an active warrant. The subject was arrested for the warrant, resisting/delaying a peace officer and providing false identity to a peace officer. The subject was booked at the Santa Rita jail. 1707-1429 L24

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported their 2017 Toyota Highlander was burglarized while parked at the Orinda Station, between 0730-1500 hours. The front passenger window was smashed and the interior was searched but no reported loss. 1707-1452 L22

fields.title: Robbery
fields.body: A victim reported they were robbed at the Coliseum Station and the loss was a cell phone. The suspect was described as a Black male, 5'6, 30 years old, dark complexion, and wearing a yellow or orange hoodie. 1707-1467 L22

fields.title: Bicycle Theft
fields.body: A victim reported their men's Univega road bike was stolen from the MacArthur Station, between 1630-2105 hours. The bike was secured to a bike rack with a Kryptonite U-Lock and cable. 1707-1463 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: An officer located a 2014 Subaru Crosstrek that was burglarized while parked at the MacArthur Station. The front passenger window was smashed and the interior was searched. 1707-1466 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: Three additional burglarized vehicles (2010 Cadillac Escalade, 2010 Audi A5, and a 2017 BMW 540i) were located at the Orinda Station. The burglaries occurred between 0630-1700 hours. The windows were smashed and the interiors were searched. 1707-1453 L22

fields.location: S.F. Airport Bound Train @ Pleasant Hill Station
fields.title: Fare Evasion /Court Order Violation
fields.body: Officers intercepted a S.F. Airport train at the Pleasant Hill Station to investigate a report of a male subject that evaded fare at the Pittsburg/Baypoint Station. While searching the train for the subject it was reported that a male subject was harassing a passenger aboard the same train. The victim, who did not wish to file a complaint, identified the male subject (Morikawa, Yaiszu 49 y/o, Sacramento) as the subject that was harassing him. A records check revealed an active stay away order from BART. The subject was issued a citation for fare evasion, as he was on the train without a valid ticket, and booked at the Martinez Detention Facility for the court order violation. 1707-1474 L24

fields.location: Pittsburg/Bay Point Bound Train @ 19th Street Station
fields.title: Indecent Exposure
fields.body: Female victim flagged down officers who were conducting a patrol check of the train regarding a subject, later identified as Nathan MAYERS (53 years old, Pittsburg), who was masturbating.  The female placed MAYERS under citizen’s arrest and he was booked into Glen Dyer jail in Oakland.  1707-1473  L15.

fields.title: Trespassing/Resisting Arrest
fields.body: Officers contacted a subject, Kelby Walker (26 years, Oakland), who refused to leave the station when it was closed after revenue service ended.  When the officers attempted to take Walker into custody, he physically resisted them.  Walker was eventually taken into custody and booked into jail at the Fremont Police Department.  1707-1472  L15.

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officers stopped a male subject (Harris, Domeenic 20 y/o, San Francisco) for fare evasion. A records check revealed three no bail, felony warrants held by the San Francisco County Sheriff's Department. The male subject was arrested on the warrants and booked at the Redwood City Jail. 1709-1509 L24

fields.title: Domestic Violence/ Poss. Of Narcotics for Sale (Prohibition Order Issued)
fields.body: Officers responded to the 19th Street Station to investigate a report of domestic violence. A male suspect  (Davis, Keymari, 20 y/o, Oakland) was identified and placed under arrest for domestic violence. Narcotics packaged for sale were recovered from the suspect's person. The suspect was booked at the Glenn Dyer Jail.  1707-1503  L24

fields.title: Warrant Arrest/ 300 Lakeside Dr., Oakland
fields.body: During a records check it was discovered that the subject (Scott, Christina 31 y/o, Oakland) had an active $15,000 warrant for domestic violence held by the Alameda County Sheriff's Office. The subject was placed under arrest and booked at the Santa Rita Jail 1707-1501

fields.title: Battery On Transit Employee (Bus Driver)
fields.body: A suspect identified as Mark Coulter (age 57) (Oakland) pushed an A/C transit bus driver (no injuries). The suspect was pointed out by the victim and witnesses and was taken into custody by BART police.

fields.title: Battery on Station Agent
fields.body: Officers were dispatched to the station for a report of a battery against a BART employee.  The officers searched the area for the suspect who was described as a Black female, 25 years old, with black curly hair to her shoulders reddish blonde hair with ponytail in a puffball shape, light bluish green jacket, and with a 5 year old child.  The suspect was in the company of another subject who was described as a light skinned other female in her twenties with blond hair.  The officers searched the area for the suspect with negative results.  1707-1537 L21

fields.title: Bicycle Theft
fields.body: A victim reported their women's TREK road bike was stolen from the Lake Merritt Station, between 0800-2130 hours. The bike was inside a bike locker but there were no signs of a forced entry. 1707-1536 L22

fields.title: Theft From Person (Arrest)
fields.body: A juvenile suspect snatched a cell phone from a victim aboard a Dublin bound train at the Castro Valley Station. The victim chased the suspect but lost them. A responding officer located the suspect near the station and he was detained. The suspect was positively identified by the victim who recovered his phone. The juvenile was placed under arrest for theft from a person. 1707-1533 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported they found their 2002 Honda Accord unlocked and their stereo missing while parked at the Castro Valley Station, between 0820-1910 hours. Its suspected the suspect used a key to enter the Honda. 1707-1528 L22

fields.title: Assault with a Deadly Weapon / Prohibition Order
fields.body: A suspect swung a crutch at the victim's head but missed. When the victim dodge the crutch, they fell to the ground and injured their leg. The suspect (Benjamin Horton, 27 years, Pleasanton) fled but was later located near the station. The victim positively identified Horton as the suspect. Horton was booked into the Martinez Detention Facility on Assault with a deadly weapon and was issued a prohibition order. Detectives were advised of the case. 1707-1532 L22

fields.title: Theft From Person
fields.body: A suspect snatched a Victim's hand aboard a Pittsburg bound bound train and fled from the MacArthur Station. Officers searched the area but were unable to locate the suspect. The suspect was described as a Black female, 20's, lighter complexion, 506 and wearing a black hoodie. 1707-1525 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary/Attempt Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported a suspect entered their 2000 Acura Integra and attempted to steal the car while parked at the North Concord Station, between 0545-1623 hours. The steering wheel column sustained damage and the vehicle's battery was stolen. 1707-1521 L22

fields.title: Attempt Theft from Person
fields.body: A victim reported a Hispanic male (20's, no shirt, bald and a signature tattoo on his back) attempted to take her cell phone but failed. The male fled away from the station. 1707-15290 L22

fields.title: Assault with a Deadly Weapon/Prohibition Order Issued
fields.body: Officers responded to a report of two males beating a male victim at the Del Norte Station. Officers arrived and determined a male suspect (Lawrence Harvey, El Cerrito, 46 years) struck the victim with a large stick causing head and shoulder injuries. Harvey was placed under arrest, was issued a prohibition order and was booked into the Martinez Detention Facility. The second male was identified, but his role in this case is under investigation. 1707-1515 L22

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officers stopped a female subject (Perez, Alexis 20 y/o, San Francisco) for fare evasion. A records check revealed a no bail, felony warrant held by the San Francisco County Sheriff's Department. The female subject was arrested on the warrant and booked at the Santa Rita Jail. 1707-1557 L24

fields.title: Domestic Violence/Possession of Narcotics (Prohibition Order)
fields.body: BART and Brentwood officers responded to a report of a male and female fighting in the parking lot.  The male fled, but was located by Brentwood officers a short distance away.  Officers determined that the male had battered the female victim following an argument.  The male was arrested for domestic violence.  A search of his person revealed a quantity of suspected marijuana and methamphetamine.  Officers obtained a protective order for the female, who was not injured.  The male was issued a prohibition order and was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility for domestic violence and possession of narcotics.  1707-1597 L18

fields.title: Auto Burglaries
fields.body: Two auto burglaries were reported in the south lot.  Both occurred between 1000-2200 hours.  An unknown suspect smashed the left rear window of a 2016 Toyota Prius and stole a laptop computer.  The suspect also smashed the right rear window of a 2015 Audi A4, and ransacked the interior.  1707-1598 L18

fields.title: Bike Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that their red and white Excalibur mountain bike was stolen from the racks in the paid area, between 7/27/18 at 0800 hours to today at 1800 hours.  The victim secured the bike with a U-lock and cable lock.  1707-1593 L18

fields.title: Theft of Bicycle Parts
fields.body: Sometime between 10:00 and 17:30, an unknown suspect removed the front tire from a bicycle that was parked in the bike racks in the center of the station. 1707-1585 L11

fields.title: Robbery
fields.body: A patron waiting on the Pittsburg platform at 12th Street Station was approached by a suspect wearing a ski mask who claimed to have a gun and demanded the victim's purse. The victim complied with the suspect's demands and the suspect fled with the loss upstairs and exited via the 11th Street stairwell. The victim was not injured and officers searched the area but were not able to locate the suspect. The suspect was described as a black male, 20-30 years old, 5'10" tall wearing dark clothes and a ski cap. 1707-1577 L11

fields.title: Auto Burglary (2)
fields.body:
A witness reported observing two suspects burglarizing a '04 BMW 320 which was parked in the parking lot near space #298. Entry was made by smashing the rear passenger-side window and the loss was an automotive emergency kit which was left on a seat in plain view. The suspects were described at 2 black males, 16-17 years old carrying a backpack. The suspects were not located.

Officers were contacted by a second victim who had parked a '15 Honda CR-V in space #298 between 13:15 and 17:00. While the car was parked at the station, an unknown suspect smashed the rear driver-side  window and removed a black backpack containing clothing. 1707-1575 / 1707-1580 L11

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: An unknown suspect entered a '97 Mazda Miata which was parked, locked and secure, in the surface parking lot next to the bus zone from 05:15 to 15:00. The loss was miscellaneous tools and the car stereo. 1707-1574 L11

fields.title: Public Intoxication/Arrest
fields.body: Two Officers were conducting a welfare check on a separate call for service when the suspect interfered with their investigation.  The officers quickly determined the suspect was too intoxicated to care for himself and was placed under arrest.  The suspect was booked into the Martinez Detention Facility for public intoxication.  1707-1617  L17

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: An Officer detained the suspect for fare evasion.  A records check revealed an outstanding $5,000 no-cite warrant held by Belmont PD for theft.  The suspect was cited for fare evasion before being booked into the Martinez Detention Facility on the warrant.  1707-1607  L17

fields.title: Indecent Exposure/Arrest (Prohibition Order)
fields.body: An Officer arrested the suspect after he was positively identified by a witness for exposing himself and masturbating in the free area of the station.  The suspect was issued a prohibition order and booked into the SF County Jail.  1707-1605  L17

fields.title: Robbery
fields.body: The victim was seated on a Daly City bound train when the suspect, described only as a Black male, 18-19 yrs, wearing dark clothing, boarded the train at either Coliseum or the Fruitvale Station, and sat next to her.  When the train stopped at the West Oakland Station, the suspect snatched the victim’s iPhone and ran from the train.  The victim gave chase and confronted the suspect.  When the victim attempted to retrieve her phone, a struggle ensued and the suspect pushed the victim to the ground before fleeing on foot from the station.  The victim was not injured.  An area check for the suspect was negative.  1707-1620  L17

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that their white 1993 Honda Accord was stolen on 7/29/17, between 1300-2359 hours.  1707-1636 L18

fields.title: Public Intoxication Arrest
fields.body:
7-30-17, 1356 hours

A female identified as Donna Kendrick (65)(Berkeley) reportedly was creating a disturbance at the station. The detention resulted in Kendrick being arrested for public intoxication. 1707-1655

fields.title: Warrant Arrest
fields.body:
7-30-17, 1220 hours

Vincent Delgado (50) (Byron, CA) was arrested for a warrant out of Alameda County. The warrant was discovered during a fare evasion detention. 1707-1647

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A patron reported that their 2007 Nissan Altima was burglarized while parked in stall #109, between 7/23/17 at 1700 hours, to today at 1930 hours.  An unknown suspect broke the sunroof to gain entry and ransacked the interior.  The owner could not identify any loss.  1707-1667 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that their 1997 Chevy Silverado pickup was stolen between 1030-1800 hours.  1707-1665 L18

fields.title: Auto Burglary (Phone Report)
fields.body: The victim’s 04’ Ford Explorer was burglarized sometime between the hours of 1300 on 7/30 and 0030, today’s date while parked in the West parking lot.  1707-1675 (Master Case) L17

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: An officer detained the suspect for fare evasion.  A records check revealed an outstanding $100,000 warrant for a probation violation.  The suspect was placed under arrest for the warrant.  The suspect was booked into the Santa Rita Jail on the warrant and issued a citation for fare evasion.  1707-1702  L17

fields.title: Auto Burglary (Phone Report)
fields.body: The victim’s 16’ Chevy Silverado truck was burglarized between the hours of 1530 on 7/30 and 0815 hours, today’s date.  The victim stated the interior of the vehicle had been rummaged through with $20 in cash and a black Samsung phone charger missing.  1707-1675  L17

fields.title: Public Intoxication/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officers detained the suspect for creating a disturbance inside the station.  A records check revealed a $2,500 warrant for public intoxication held by the Alameda County Sheriff’s Office.  The suspect was placed under arrest for public intoxication and the warrant.  The suspect was booked into the Martinez Detention Facility.  1707-1691  L17

fields.title: Grand Theft (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: The victim reported that on 7/28, between the hours of 0605-1725, the catalytic converter was stolen from his 04’ Honda Element while parked in stall #1333. 1707-1678  L17

fields.title: Armed Robbery
fields.body: A male victim reported that he was in his vehicle in the lot near 35th Avenue when two suspects approached (#1 - BM, 22-23 years, 5'11", thin, all black clothing, no description of suspect #2). Suspect #1 produced a black semi-automatic handgun and demanded money from the victim. The victim said he didn't have any money, so the suspect took his cell phone and fled the area. The victim was not injured. 1707-1738 L16

fields.title: Warrant Arrest/Pittsburg Station
fields.body: A male subject (Pendar, Njawa, 39 y/o, San Jose) was detained for fare evasion at the Pittsburg Station. A records check revealed a $10,000 warrant for possession of stolen property held by the Mountain View Police Department. The male subject was arrested for the warrant and booked at the Martinez Detention Facility. 1708-0010 L24

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Court Order Violation/Arrest- Fremont Station
fields.body: Officers stopped a male subject (Henderson, Shawn 54 y/o, Oakland) for fare evasion. A records check revealed a court order prohibiting the subject from entering BART property. The subject was cited for fare evasion and booked at the Santa Rita Jail for the court order violation. 1708-0021 L24

fields.title: Bike Theft
fields.body: A victim reported his men's Road master road bike was stolen from the West Oakland Station on 7/31/17, between 1000 - 1700 hours. The bike was secured to the bike racks with a cable lock. 1708-0058 L22

fields.title: Lodging / Trespassing / Vandalism Arrest
fields.body: An adult male was discovered to be lodging in a pump room at the station. The male suspect had vandalized a lock and damaged some wiring in the room. He was booked into the San Francisco Jail for the listed charges and a probation violation. 1708-0077 L16

fields.title: Suspicious Person/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: An adult male (Redden, Ishmael 56 y/o, San Leandro) was contacted for suspicious activity at the San Leandro Station. A records check revealed a felony warrant issued by the Napa County Sheriff's Office. The male was booked at the Santa Rita Jail in Dublin for the warrant. 1708-0103 L24

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A 1993 Ford Escort was stolen between 0430-2339 hours. 1708-0156 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A vehicle was burglarized while parked in the parking structure between 1800-2330 hours. A window was smashed to gain entry and a handbag was taken. 1708-0155 L16

fields.title: Focused Enforcement Detail
fields.body: The chief of police, a deputy chief, a sergeant and an officer conducted fare evasion enforcement at Coliseum Station, from 1045-1315 hours. During this detail 14 violators were contacted, 7 citations issued, 5 warning citations were issued and 2 Field Interviews were completed.

fields.title: Focused Enforcement Detail
fields.body: One sergeant and four officers conducted fare evasion enforcement at the El Cerrito del Norte Station, from 0700-0900 hours. During this detail, 17 violators were contacted, 2 arrests were made for outstanding warrants, 10 citations issued, 2 warning citations, and 3 Field Interviews were completed.  L24

fields.title: Auto Burglaries (3)- Richmond Station
fields.body: Three auto burglaries were reported at the Richmond Station in the parking garage. All three incidents occurred between 1700 hours on 8/2/17 and 0400 hours on 8/3/17.  An unknown suspect smashed the right front window of a 1998 Honda Civic and stole a Fastrak transponder and a car stereo remote control.  The suspect also smashed the left front window of a 2003 Mercedes E500 and stole the vehicle's registration, insurance card and a roll of toilet paper. The suspect smashed the right rear window of a 2005 Volkswagen Jetta and searched the interior. The suspect did not remove any loss from the vehicle. 1708-0163, 1708-0183, 1708-0193 L24

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest-Pittsburg/Bay Point Station
fields.body: A male subject (Douglas, Steven, 39 y/o, Antioch) was detained for fare evasion at the Pittsburg/Bay Point Station. A records check revealed three active warrants valued at $25,000 each.  Douglas was issued a warning cite for fare evasion and arrested for the warrants. He was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility. 1708-0228 L24

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: A male subject (Alacorn, Ricardo, 24 y/o, San Leandro) was detained for fare evasion at the El Cerrito Del Norte Station. A records check revealed a no bail warrant for a violation of probation held by the Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office. Alacorn was cited for fare evasion and arrested for the warrant. He was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility. 1708-0172 L24

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: A male subject (Gandy-Williams, Demichael, 28 y/o, Vacaville) was detained for fare evasion at the El Cerrito Del Norte Station. A records check revealed a $10,000 warrant for possession of narcotics held by the Fairfield Police Department. Gandy-Williams was cited for fare evasion and arrested for the warrant. He was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility. 1708-0169 L24

fields.title: Assault with a Deadly Weapon
fields.body: A male victim was seated on a train when a male suspect (BM, late 30s, 6', muscular, grey shirt, tan shorts, black shoes) hit him in the head with an unknown metal object. The suspect also punched and kicked the victim before fleeing the train and running out of the station. According to the victim and witnesses, the attack was unprovoked. The suspect was not located. The victim was treated for a laceration to his head and transported to the hospital via ambulance with non-life threatening injuries. 1708-0265 L16

fields.title: Grand Theft (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: A catalytic converter was taken from a 2002 Honda Accord while it was parked at the station between 0640-1700 hours. 1708-0262 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A vehicle was burglarized while parked on the Pleasanton side of the station between 1615-1730 hours. 1708-0259 L16

fields.title: Auto theft
fields.body: A victim reported their 1996 Honda Accord was stolen from the South Hayward Station, between 0715-1730 hours. 1708-0254 L22

fields.title: Disturbing the Peace/Public Intoxication/Resisting Arrest
fields.body: Patrons reported a male (Joseph Jones, 36, San Francisco) was creating a disturbance on a Dublin bound train and Jones off-boarded at the West Dublin Station. An officer attempted to stop Jones but he fled and force was used to stop him. Jones was determined to be too intoxicated to care for himself and was in possession of narcotics paraphernalia. Jones was booked into the Glenn Dyer Jail. 1708-0242 L22

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: An officer located a 2007 Hyundai Elantra that sustained a broken rear passenger window and the trunk was searched at the West Oakland Station. A note was left for the owner. 1708-0233 L22

fields.title: Focused Enforcement Detail
fields.body: four officers conducted a fare evasion operation from 1630 - 1800 hours at the station that resulted in 16 people being stopped: 9 citations issued, 3 Field Identifications completed and 5 warnings issued. L22

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Service
fields.body: An officer contacted and detained a subject (Taylor, Omar 30 years old out of San Francisco) for fare evasion.  A wants check revealed that the subject had two no bail warrants out of San Francisco.  The subject was arrested and booked into the Martinez Jail facility for his warrants.  1706-0330 L21

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported that his vehicle (a 1999 Honda) was burglarized while parked in Lot A on today's date.  1708-0333 L21

fields.title: Grand Theft (Bike)
fields.body: A white Cannondale, 20 speed, bike ($1100 value) was taken on 7/25/17 between 0900-1800 hours. The bike had been secured inside of bike locker #23. 1708-0317 L24

fields.title: Grand Theft (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: A catalytic converter was taken from a 2003 Acura TL while it was parked at the station on 8/3/17 between 0730-1800 hours. 1708-0313 L24

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Sex Offender Registration Violation/Weapons Charge/Narcotics Violation/ Probation Violation
fields.body: An officer detained a subject (Wilson, Jayson, 44, Hayward) for fare evasion at the station. A records check revealed a sex registration violation. The subject was arrested for the sex registration violation. During a search incident to arrest, suspected Methamphetamine, narcotics paraphernalia and a dirk/dagger were recovered. The subject was additionally arrested for the weapon, narcotics and probation violation. The subject was booked at the Santa Rita Jail.  1708-0307 L21

fields.title: Court Order Violation/Sex Offender Registration Violation
fields.body: A male subject (Vaughn, Iran, 55, Oakland) was contacted for blocking the aisle while aboard a Pittsburg-bound train. A records check revealed a sex registration violation and an active stay away order from the BART system. The subject was arrested for the sex registration violation and the stay away order. The subject was booked at the Glenn Dyer Jail in Oakland. 1708-0291 L24

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: A male subject (Regan, Matthew, 34, Concord) was detained for fare evasion. A records check revealed a $10,000 warrant for theft held by the Union City Police Department. Regan was cited for fare evasion and arrested for the warrant. He was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility. 1708-0300 L24

fields.title: Violation of Court Order/Resisting Arrest
fields.body: A witness reported that a male suspect was stalking a female victim in the lower parking lot.  Officers responded and detained the man.  They learned that the female had a restraining order against the male.  The male resisted being arrested, but was taken into custody after a brief struggle.  He was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility for violation of a court order and resisting arrest.  1708-0352 L18

fields.title: Bike Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that her green Schwinn hybrid bike was stolen from the racks between 1300-1745 hours.  The victim secured the bike with a cable lock.  1708-0347 L18

fields.title: Possession of Burglary Tools/Probation Violation
fields.body: A witness reported that a male suspect was attempting to steal a bike at North Concord Station.  The suspect was unsuccessful, and boarded a train to Pittsburg Station.  The suspect was reportedly in possession of bolt cutters and several knives.  Officers detained the man and he admitted that he attempted to steal a bike.  Record checks revealed that the man was on probation for theft.  The man was arrested for possession of burglary tools and probation violation.  He was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility.  1708-0351 L18

fields.title: Bike Theft
fields.body: A victim reported that they locked their bicycle at the station today at 0900 hours.  The bicycle was secured with cable lock.  The victim returned at 1610 hours to find their bicycle gone. 1708-0332 L21

fields.title: Trespassing/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Dispatch was advised of a subject who was on the BART track way south of the Hayward Station (near Orchard Avenue).  The suspect boarded a Richmond train after being spoken to by a train operator.  Officers detained the subject at the Hayward Station and determined he was a danger to himself.  A wants check revealed that the subject (Garcia, Raymond, 31, Fairfield)  had a no bail burglary warrant issued out from San Diego County; which was extraditable.  The subject was placed under a psychiatric detention with a criminal hold for the warrant.  TSOC was advised.  1608-0395 L21

fields.title: Resisting Arrest/Probation Violation
fields.body: An officer was at the station when he observed a subject (Bertolini, Anthony 31, Concord) who appeared was going to fare evade to enter the station.  The subject, who was acting suspiciously, was later reportedly on the platform acting erratic.  The officer contacted the subject who resisted the detention.  The subject was placed in handcuffs with the assistance of a responding sergeant.  The subject is to be booked at the Martinez Detention Facility for resisting arrest, probation violation, and is to be issued a citation for fare evasion. 1708-0393 L21

fields.title: Violation of Probation
fields.body: An officer detained a male subject for fare evasion. A wants check revealed that the subject (Hendrix, James, 62 years old, Oakland) was on probation and that a term of the probation was to stay away from all BART Stations. The subject was arrested and booked into the Martinez Detention Facility for probation violation.  1708-0385 L21

fields.title: Attempted Robbery
fields.body: Witnesses reported that a female juvenile attempted to rob a female patron while on the Daly City bound train.  The suspect was part of a group of about 10 juveniles.  The suspect was described as a black female, wearing a pink shirt and denim shorts.  The suspect pepper sprayed the victim and a male companion, before fleeing from the station.  Responding officers were unable to locate the suspects in the area.  The victims were not injured.  1708-0420 L18

fields.title: Domestic Violence (Prohibition Order)
fields.body: Witnesses reported that a male and female were involved in a physical fight on the Pittsburg bound train.  The train was held at Walnut Creek while officers responded.  Officers detained both parties on the concourse, and ultimately determined that the female was the primary aggressor.  She was arrested for domestic violence and was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility.  The train was delayed about 11 minutes.  1708-0414 L18

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A witness reported that a male suspect was attempting to break into cars in the lot.  Officers detained the man and ultimately determined that he had permission to enter the vehicle.  Record checks showed that the man had two outstanding no-bail arrest warrants for narcotics violations, held by Stockton PD and the San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office.  The man was arrested on his warrants and was booked at Santa Rita Jail.  1708-0413 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A patron reported that their red 1997 Honda CRV was stolen from the 3rd level of the parking structure, between 0610-1715 hours.  1708-0406 L18

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported that their vehicle, a 2015 Dodge Charger, was stolen from the station, sometime between 8/4/17 at 0750 hours to today at 1630 hours.  1708-0397 L21

fields.title: Warrant Service
fields.body: An officer contacted a subject for fare evasion.  A wants check revealed that the subject (Corleto, Eugenio 23 years old) had a felony no bail warrant for probation violation issued by the San Mateo County Sheriff's Office.  The subject was also in possession of suspected narcotics.  The subject was arrested and booked into the Redwood City Jail for the aforementioned charges. 17087-0399 L21

fields.title: Attempted Robbery/Possession of Narcotics and Drug Paraphernalia Arrest (Prohibition Order Issued)
fields.body: A male suspect attempted to take a suitcase from a male victim while on the platform. The victim attempted to stop the suspect from taking the luggage and the suspect punched him in the face. A short fight ensued and other witnesses intervened to help the victim maintain possession of the suitcase. The victim suffered minor facial injuries during the incident. Officers were able to detain the suspect without incident and discovered that he was in possession of suspected rock cocaine and a crack pipe. He was issued a prohibition order and booked into the Martinez Detention Facility for attempted robbery and possession of narcotics and drug paraphernalia. The victim was treated on scene for his minor injuries. 1708-0431 L16

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Violation of a Court Order
fields.body: An officer contacted an adult male for fare evasion and discovered that he has a valid stay away order to stay away from all BART stations. The male was booked into the Santa Rita Jail for the court order violation. 1708-0432 L16

fields.title: Bike Theft/Possession of Burglary Tools/Warrant Arrest/Possession of Narcotics for Sale (Prohibition Order)
fields.body: A witness reported a male suspect stealing a bike.  Officers detained the man nearby.  Record checks showed that the man had an outstanding $20,000 arrest warrant for theft, held by Lakeport PD.  Burglary tools and quantities of suspected heroin and methamphetamine packaged for sale were found on his person.  The man was issued a prohibition order and he was booked at the Berkeley Jail.  1708-0477 L18

fields.title: DUI Arrest
fields.body: An officer on routine patrol made a traffic enforcement stop adjacent to the station and determined that the driver was intoxicated.  The man was arrested and booked at Glenn Dyer Jail for DUI.  1708-0472 L18

fields.title: Domestic Violence (Prohibition Order)
fields.body: Witnesses reported a male and female in a fight near the ticket machines.  The male pushed the female to the floor, and she suffered minor head injuries.  Officers detained the male and ultimately arrested him for domestic violence.  The female was transported to a local hospital for treatment.  The male was issued a prohibition order and was booked at the SF County Jail.  1708-0471 L18

fields.title: Battery/Violation of Court Order/Probation Violation
fields.body: Witnesses reported that a male suspect may have battered patrons.  No victims wished to make a complaint.  However, record checks showed that the man had an active stay-away order from all BART stations, and was on probation for battery.  The man was arrested and booked at the Martinez Detention Facility.  1708-0481 L18

fields.title: Vehicle Theft
fields.body: Victim reported the theft of his vehicle parked at the station. An officer took the report. 1708-0501

fields.title: Update:  Assault w/ Deadly Weapon & Battery (Prohibition Order)
fields.body: On todays date, a reporting party advised that he saw a suspect from a previous assault case.  Officers located the suspect and took him into custody.  The suspect was taken to jail for the above violations and given a prohibition order.  1708-0265

fields.title: Grand Theft from a Person
fields.body: A female victim reported that a male juvenile grabbed her cell phone from her hand and ran off the train with three other males. Officers located two juveniles near the station and detained them. The victim could not identify them as being involved in the crime. The other two suspects were not located. A search of the area revealed the victim's phone nearby. The victim was not injured. The detained males were identified and ultimately released to their parents. 1708-0564 L16

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported that their 2008 Taizu motor scooter was taken from the motorcycle parking area between 0930-2105 hours. 1708-0557 L16

fields.title: Robbery
fields.body: A male victim reported that two male suspects (BM juveniles, one wearing a white hoodie) held him down while they took his laptop computer and ran out of the train and out of the station. The suspects were not located. 1708-0561 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported that his vehicle was entered via unknown means (no damage) and the battery was removed from under his hood. The theft occurred between 0800-1900 hours. 1708-0543 L16

fields.title: Grand Theft from a Person
fields.body: A male victim reported that a juvenile suspect in a group of about five (BMs and BFs, 14-17 years old) grabbed his laptop after he had fallen asleep and the suspects ran out of the train at the Coliseum Station. The victim was not injured and stayed on the train to make the report at the San Leandro Station. The suspects were not located and the device could not be tracked. 1708-0542 L16

fields.title: Petty Theft (3 Bicycles)
fields.body: Three victim s reported the theft of their bikes from the bike racks. A grey 5-spd unisex bike was taken between 0733-1745 hours. A Costco infinity 7-spd bike was taken between 0815-1855 hours. A Modic folding bike was taken between 1700-1920 hours. All three had been secured with a cable lock. 1708-0524, 1708-0539 and 1708-0545 L16

fields.title: Petty Theft (Bicycle)
fields.body: A victim forgot his black/green Schwinn 21-spd road bike on the platform and boarded a train. When he returned on the next train, the bike was gone. 1708-0535 L16

fields.title: Petty Theft (Bicycle)
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their silver and copper 6-spd NEXT Power Climber bike from the bike racks. The bike was taken between 0730-1830 hours and had been secured with a cable lock. 1708-0538 L16

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A black 1998 Honda Accord was stolen while parked at the station between 0845-1830 hours. 1708-0541 L16

fields.title: Warrant Arrest / Vandalism -- Powell St
fields.body: A female subject (Miesha Williams 6/9/92, Vallejo) was detained for fare evasion.  A records check revealed a $75,000 warrant for arson out of Solano county.  Williams was relocated to the police office to confirm the warrant.  While waiting in the holding cell, Williams kicked and damaged the door resulting in a vandalism charge.  Williams was arrested for the warrant, vandalism and cited for fare evasion.  She was booked at San Francisco Jail.   1708-0590 S33

fields.title: Warrant Arrest -- Pittsburg/Bay Point
fields.body: A male subject (Patrick Schuh 10/7/79) was detained for fare evasion.  A records check revealed a $75,000 warrant for domestic violence out of San Francisco.  Schuh was cited for fare evasion and arrested for the warrant.  He was booked at the Martinez Detention Facility.  1708-0587 S33

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: An officer contacted an adult male for fare evasion and discovered that he had a $20,000 warrant for domestic violence. The male was booked into the Glenn Dyer Jail for the warrant. 1708-0670 L16

fields.title: Grand Theft (Bicycle)
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their $1000 black Specialized Tarmac road bike from the Bike Link room. The bike was stolen on 8/3 between 0815-1300 hours. 1708-0675 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary
fields.body: A victim reported that their vehicle was burglarized while parked on the 6th floor of the parking structure between 1800 hours on 8/7 and 1700 hours on 8/8. The window was smashed to gain entry and a charger was taken. 1708-0662 L16

fields.title: Grand theft (Catalytic Converter)
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of the catalytic converter from their 2004 Honda Element. 1708-0668 L16

fields.title: Auto Burglary (Cold)
fields.body: Victim reported his vehicle was broken into via a window smash while parked at the station.  Officer took the report. 1708-0635

fields.title: Failure to Obey Posted Sign/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officer detained a subject for failing to obey the posted sign.  A record’s check revealed the subject had a warrant for his arrest.  Subject was issued a citation for the vehicle code violation and booked at jail for the warrant. Officer took the report. 1708-0619

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Felon in Possession of Loaded & Stolen Firearm/Possession for Sales/Warrants Arrest
fields.body: Officer detained a subject for fare evasion.  A record’s check revealed the subject had a warrant for his arrest. Incident to the warrant arrest, subject was found to be in possession of a loaded and stolen firearm and narcotics. Subject was issued a citation for fare evasion and a prohibition order and then booked for the warrant, sales and weapons charges.  1708-0612

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officers detained a subject for fare evasion.  A record’s check revealed the subject had a warrant for his arrest.  Subject was issued a citation for fare evasion and booked at jail for the warrant.  1708-0605

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officer detained a subject for fare evasion.  A record’s check revealed the subject had a warrant for his arrest.  Subject was issued a citation for fare evasion and booked at jail for the warrant.  1708-0598

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: Officer detained a subject for fare evasion.  A record’s check revealed subject had two warrants for his arrest.  Subject was issued a citation for fare evasion and booked at jail for the warrants.  1708-0595

fields.title: Fare Evasion/ Warrant Arrest- Pittsburg Station
fields.body: Officer detained a subject for fare evasion.  A warrant check revealed subject had a warrant for his arrest.  Subject was issued a citation for fare evasion and booked at jail for the warrant.  1708-0587

fields.title: Fare Evasion/ False ID to Peace Officer
fields.body: Officers detained a subject for fare evasion.  Subject refused to give true name for approximately 80 minutes. Eventually officers identified the subject.  Subject was issued a citation for fare evasion and booked at jail for the false identification to a peace officer.  1708-0584

fields.title: Auto Theft
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of their 2001 Chevy Suburban from the lot. The vehicle was taken between 1300-0026 hours. 1708-0681 L16

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Violation of Court Order
fields.body: A Sergeant detained the suspect (Warren, Marcus 56, Hayward) for fare evasion.  A records check revealed a valid stay away order from all BART stations.  The suspect was placed under arrest for the court order violation and booked into the Santa Rita Jail.  The suspect was also cited for fare evasion.  0809-0698  L17

fields.title: Fare Evasion/Warrant Arrest
fields.body: An officer detained the suspect (Woods, Karl 52, Oakland) for fare evasion.  A records check revealed a $10,000 warrant for theft.  The suspect was placed under arrest for the warrant and booked into The Martinez Jail.  The suspect was also cited for fare evasion.  1708-0688  L17

fields.title: Petty Theft (Bicycle)
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of his blue Navarro road bike from the bike racks. It had been secured with a cable and U-lock and was taken between 0710-1815 hours. 1708-0740 L16

fields.title: Petty Theft (Bicycle)
fields.body: A victim reported the theft of his black Giant 18-spd bike from the bike racks. The bike was secured with a U-lock and taken between 0800-1720 hours. 1708-0730 L16

fields.title: Vehicle Theft
fields.body: Victim reported the theft of his turquoise 1991 Acura Integra. The vehicle was taken between 1120-1600 hours. 1708-0728 L16

fields.text: http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/Man-allegedly-masturbating-on-BART-placed-under-11506482.php
Theft of a prosthesis?
Good work by law enforcement hope the woman helps D.A. prosecute and get away from that kind of guy.

Wow brazen to do at in afternoon at a busy station ,how did suspect get in paid area and leave so easily. Bart has to do better job of keeping paid patrons safe . I hope the new chief comes up with a better than that they are using because it obviously needs a new approach.

Wow brazen to do at in afternoon at a busy station ,how did suspect get in paid area and leave so easily. Bart has to do better job of keeping paid patrons safe . I hope the new chief comes up with a better than that they are using because it obviously needs a new approach.
Seems like the 852 popularity is crossing sf over to the eastbay. People have to be aware to not leave anything of value visible in autos period .
They need to do more of this at trouble spots .Also have plain clothes officers around more .
A records check ?
Typical idiot!  I hope they can extract some cash out of this scumbag to offset the cost of his crimes.
mah escort!!!
Finally!!! And trust me, there is more than fare evasion going on at that station....
If crime happens on a train, do they tell you which line and which direction?

Did that car have a video camera?  
Which station did Thug get off at?
    
Did the thug leave an empty alcohol bottle in a brown paper sack, with his fingerprints on it?     
Most of them do.  

What percent of the crimes are done by large black males, in their teens, or 30s?

We need a law to require all BART tickets to contain the owners CDL#, so we can track the 
name & address of all riders.  

The video will show which station thug got on from.

Was the victim white & small?     If so this was a violation of the Federal Civil Rights Act.       Another racist attack by a large, large, large, black male.         He is now telling his mother that "the media is giving large black males a bad reputation."       Chris Rock does a whole comedy routine about how "the media"  is giving large black men a "bad reputation".        Small Asian women   are attacked by large black males more often than any other  group of victims.
Nothing was stolen?     This clearly indicates the attack at Bay Fair Station was a racist attack by a large thug BM.   Was the victim Asian, Latin, Indian, Black or White?

Why is BART security staff hiding the crime information?   We need to know if the "security" department is being staff by large Black males, who are trying to prevent the public from knowing at which stations the attack by large BM thugs are happening.   What is the race of the supervisor of the Bart "Security"?    Do I smell a conspiracy?

Looking at the records of reports of just today, it looks like these efforts catch 5+ people an hour and reel in people with outstanding warrants.  Imagine what they would get if the stations were staffed. Oh wait...
Why would anyone trust a bike lock at an Oakland station?
Nice return for 1.5 hours of surveillance.  Keep the fare jumping slugs guessing where your gonna show up next.  As to optimization of results ... this issue is very susceptible to OR theory ...

I believe the five warnings issued were to minors because apparently a new law was passed that prohibits arrests or even citations being given to minors for fare evasion.  Is that crazy or what?  There's zero incentive to follow the law when we tell youth that there will be zero consequences for breaking the law!

The following is the first several paragraphs from a San Francisco Chronicle article on May 7, 2017:

BART is poised to spend millions of dollars to halt fare cheating, but it turns out the transit agency is largely powerless to punish gate-jumping juveniles — thanks to a new state law.

Under the law, which took effect in January, “those under 18 years of age cannot be arrested or cited for fare evasion,” acting BART Police Chief Jeffrey Jennings wrote in a training bulletin to his officers on March 16.

The law, SB882 by state Sen. Robert Hertzberg, D-Van Nuys, was directed at keeping juveniles from racking up misdemeanor arrests on their records just for jumping fare gates.

The result: BART has yet to issue a single citation to a juvenile fare jumper this year.

BART says fare evaders are costing the system up to $25 million a year. The mob of 40-plus juveniles who took over a train car at the Coliseum Station on April 22 and robbed the passengers committed a host of crimes — but it should be noted that they also all jumped the fare gates.

BART officials insist that the new state law doesn’t mean juvenile offenders are given a free pass to ride their system. Station agents and police can refuse entry to juveniles who don’t have a ticket, “and BART can eject juvenile fare evaders from the system,” said spokesman Jim Allison.   }}}
